intro: Bryonia cucumeroides, commonly known as the bitter cucumber, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes other familiar plants like cucumbers and melons. The plant produces yellow flowers and has a distinctive, often foul-smelling fruit that resembles a cucumber. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are hairy and tend to be somewhat succulent. The plant is known for its toxic properties, particularly in its roots and leaves, which contain compounds like alkaloids.
